com.wizarpos.devices.serial
Interface SerialControl

All Superinterfaces:
DeviceControl
public interface SerialControl
extends DeviceControl

The SerialControl interface defines the serial communication APIs to be used by the applications.

A control instance is obtained from the Device Manager with no specific device association. The control is associated with a device through a call to open(), passing the service logical ID. This association is lost when close() is called on the device control.

STOPBITS_1_5

static final int STOPBITS_1_5
1-1/2 stop bits. Some UARTs permit 1-1/2 STOP bits only with 5 data bit format, but permit 1 or 2 STOP bits with any format.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARITY_NONE

static final int PARITY_NONE
no parity bits

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARITY_ODD

static final int PARITY_ODD
ODD parity scheme. The parity bit is added so there are an odd number of TRUE bits.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARITY_EVEN

static final int PARITY_EVEN
EVEN parity scheme. The parity bit is added so there are an even number of TRUE bits.

Method Detail

open

void open(int serialID)
          throws DeviceException
Connects the serial communication control to a specific serial port.

Opens and initializes the platform serial port specified in parameter.

This method is synchronous.

Parameters:
serialID - the logical ID of the serial port to open
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the logical ID is invalid. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)

getBaudRate

int getBaudRate()
                throws DeviceException
Gets the currently configured baud rate.

This method is synchronous.

Returns:
integer representing the current baud rate
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open

Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open

changeRTS

void changeRTS(boolean rts)
               throws DeviceException
Sets or clears the RTS (Request To Send) bit in the UART.

This method is synchronous.

Parameters:
rts - true to set RTS, false to clear RTS
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.

retrieveRTS

boolean retrieveRTS()
                    throws DeviceException
Retrieves the state of the RTS (Request To Send) bit in the UART.

This method is synchronous.

Returns:
true, RTS is set.
false, RTS is cleared.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.

                    throws DeviceException

This method is synchronous.

Returns:
true, CTS is set. false, CTS is cleared.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.

changeFlowControlMode

void changeFlowControlMode(int flowControl)
                           throws DeviceException
Changes the flow control mode.

This method is synchronous.

Parameters:
flowControl - a constant as defined in SerialControl:
  • FLOWCONTROL_NONE - no flow control
  • FLOWCONTROL_RTSCTS_IN - RTS/CTS (hardware) flow control for input
  • FLOWCONTROL_RTSCTS_OUT - RTS/CTS (hardware) flow control for output
  • FLOWCONTROL_RTSCTS_IN_OUT - RTS/CTS (hardware) flow control for input and output
  • FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_IN - XON/XOFF (software) flow control for input
  • FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_OUT - XON/XOFF (software) flow control for output
  • FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_IN_OUT - XON/XOFF (software) flow control for input and output
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if flowControl is not a valid constant. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)

                       throws DeviceException

This method is synchronous.

a constant as defined in SerialControl:

  • FLOWCONTROL_RTSCTS_IN_OUT - RTS/CTS (hardware) flow control for input and output
  • FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_IN - XON/XOFF (software) flow control for input
  • FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_OUT - XON/XOFF (software) flow control for output
  • FLOWCONTROL_XONXOFF_IN_OUT - XON/XOFF (software) flow control for input and output

changeSerialPortParams

void changeSerialPortParams(int baudrate,
                            int dataBits,
                            int stopBits,
                            int parity)
                            throws DeviceException
Changes the serial port parameters.

Parameters:
baudrate - the desired data communication speed
dataBits -
  • DATABITS_5 - 5 bits
  • DATABITS_6 - 6 bits
  • DATABITS_7 - 7 bits
  • DATABITS_8 - 8 bits
stopBits -
  • STOPBITS_1 - 1 stop bit
  • STOPBITS_2 - 2 stop bits
  • STOPBITS_1_5 - 1.5 stop bits
parity -
  • PARITY_NONE - no parity
  • PARITY_ODD - odd parity
  • PARITY_EVEN - even parity
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters are not valid constants. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)

           int offset,
           int len)
           throws DeviceException
Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset to the open output stream.

This method is synchronous.

Parameters:
data - the data to be written to the output
offset - the starting offset in the data buffer
len - the number of bytes to be written
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is null, or offset and/or len are invalid when applied to this data. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)

listenForRead

void listenForRead(int len,
                   int timeout,
                   OperationListener listener)
                   throws DeviceException
Reads up to byteCount bytes from this serial control and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at byteOffset. Returns the number of bytes actually read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached. Reads len bytes of data.

This method is asynchronous. On success, the read data can be retrieved using SerialOperationResult's getBuffer() method.

Because this method uses a timeout parameter, the service receiving this request MUST be able to successfully respond to cancelRequest() and abort the operation.

In the case that a timeout occurs, the buffer in the operation event contains the bytes received so far, up to the requested length. This operation event has status=EVT_ERROR and info=ERR_TIMEOUT regardless of whether any data has been received. SerialOperationResult.getDataLength() can be used to check how much data, if any, have been received.

Parameters:
len - the number of bytes to be read
timeout - the maximum sleeping time of the method, in milliseconds. Note that the timeout will begin when the request begins to be processed. The timeout parameter is then only indicative. There are two special cases for timeout, as follows:
  • If timeout == FOREVER, the method will wait until something is available on the associated service's input.
  • If timeout == IMMEDIATE, the method will immediately read the input
listener - the OperationListener to handle the result.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if len is a negative value or timeout an illegal value. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)
See Also:
OperationListener.handleResult(com.wizarpos.devices.OperationResult), SerialOperationResult, TimeConstants.FOREVER, TimeConstants.IMMEDIATE

waitForRead

SerialOperationResult waitForRead(int len,
                                  int timeout)
                                  throws DeviceException
The synchronous method of listenForRead.

Parameters:
len - the number of bytes to be read
timeout - the maximum sleeping time of the method, in milliseconds. Note that the timeout will begin when the request begins to be processed. The timeout parameter is then only indicative. There are two special cases for timeout, as follows:
  • If timeout == FOREVER, the method will wait until something is available on the associated service's input.
  • If timeout == IMMEDIATE, the method will immediately read the input
Returns:
the SerialOperationResult of this operation.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if len is a negative value or timeout an illegal value. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)
See Also:
SerialOperationResult, TimeConstants.FOREVER, TimeConstants.IMMEDIATE
